entries.s_fd5402d8: Ah! Then it should give you information about where to go to start your naval adventure. Good luck, my friend!
entries.s_f3ec92a: Use the planetary map to travel to the vendors listed on it, but not all vendors will be listed there. For the unlisted ones, you'll have to travel around looking for player-owned buildings that hold vendors. Once you've found a vendor, double-click it to see what it has for sale. You can also check bazaar terminals, but the listings on those will only be low-end starships and ship components, if even that.
entries.s_eab69714: Strange. Seems that if they undertook the risk to send you a message, they would make it clear how to respond. Why don't you check your email a little closer.
entries.s_e843e3ab: Use the command CTRL+V to open the planetary map. On the right side of your display, you will see a listing of trainers by category. All local trainers who register with the planet will appear on this list. Click the 'Trainer' tab and then look for a pilot trainer.
entries.s_e6b5489e: I retired. And I'm pretty happy about it. The only thing I miss is the flying. The rest of it can rot. All the forms and logs to keep track of, safeguarding your cargo, having to deal with bureaucracy and red tape every time you docked at a space station or planetary starport. No thanks. It is the journey I miss, but not the destinations.
entries.s_e1c13ebb: Double-click on the envelope icon, and read your mail! Anything else?
entries.s_e013f498: Look for the flashing 'envelope' icon on your interface. It's placed on the lower right-hand side of your screen by default.
entries.s_da08c873: That's sort of tricky. There may be some Alliance pilots bold enough to register their locations on the planetary map. Have you looked at the planetary map yet?
entries.s_d9231b4f: There are freelance pilots working in most systems. Some are CorSec pilots, others are part of the RSF of Naboo, and of course, others are smugglers or pirates. I wouldn't recommend those last two if you want to pursue a lengthy career, but, at the same time, some of the best military pilots I know were once smugglers. Most freelance organizations will send recruitment emails. You might try checking your email for something like that.
entries.s_cf5fc0f: How do I repair my starship?
entries.s_cdb17e79: How do I check the planetary map?
entries.s_cb747ceb: Hmm. Me neither. Maybe you should give it a little time?
entries.s_c9e97ed5: How else would I join up?
entries.s_c00207b0: Hello. Hello. You have the look of one seeking adventures in space. Flying is the only part of the job I miss. I was a captain on a freighter, you see. Flew all over the galaxy. Ah, nothing matches being at the helm of a ship flying through the deep, black reaches of space.
entries.s_ba95f774: Bazaar terminals are located all over major cities. Check the areas surrounding major hot spots like the starport, the bank, any of the cantinas, or even the hospitals.
entries.s_ba3c26af: You did? These are desperate times, indeed. The email should probably indicate where you are supposed to go for initial recruitment.
entries.s_b641cda6: Where can I find a bazaar terminal?
entries.s_acc368b1: How do I join the Empire?
entries.s_abc6d2f6: Your best bet is to get in touch with the Empire and sign up for their training program. There are others who will urge you to put your efforts to use in the Alliance, but fools will be fools.
entries.s_a9850aec: I got an email from the Alliance!
entries.s_a8aae630: [He doesn't say anything, but gestures toward his protocol droid.]
entries.s_97856fdc: If I can answer them, I'd be more than happy to do so.
entries.s_8cf9be64: Where can I find a vendor?
entries.s_8b23fac: I want to learn to fly.
entries.s_8515e448: Yes. I have an email from the Imperial Navy.
entries.s_82519d76: Things are tough all over during this Galactic Civil War. A lot of pilots are flying for either the Empire or the Rebellion these days. Ever think of joining the military to get a starship?
entries.s_72df796a: Good luck with that. I don't want to get too close to the Galactic Civil War, myself.
entries.s_6f5ce457: That's what I hear. Or something like that anyway. The Empire's pretty well-equipped and can't really have much of a navy if their pilots don't have ships. I've also heard rumors that the Alliance has a fleet of ships for new recruits.
entries.s_68cb68ff: Is there anyone else I could fly for?
entries.s_5ff8baab: I was wondering if you could answer some questions?
entries.s_5e410744: Right-click on the map location to create and activate a waypoint. Follow the waypoint to the trainer's location.
entries.s_5cd38acb: That makes sense. Have fun with that.
entries.s_5989c487: There are all sorts of civilian contracts available on the 'mission terminals' you find throughout town. Look for them near any major structure. Use the terminal to bring up the current list of local contracts. Choose the one that interests you most and you'll make money when the task is complete.
entries.s_5618d2cd: No. I have received no email.
entries.s_55c77e3b: On the lower right-hand side of your screen should be a 'letter' icon that is flashing. Double-click on this icon and it will bring up your personal email. Read over the subject and sender, and scroll through the body text to get all the details.
entries.s_558a361a: The Imperial Navy? I've heard that they are sending out recruitment emails to everyone they can locate these days. Have you checked your email today?
entries.s_52939a0: How do I check my email?
entries.s_495777c0: Have you checked any vendors? Merchants use vendors to help sell their merchandise. Shipwrights put finished starships and ship components for sale on their vendors, and then you can go to those vendors and purchase what you need.
entries.s_472f61d1: Local space stations are the easiest way to get your ship repaired. When you are heading back here, you should stop at the space station and ask them for repairs. They will provide a quick estimate on what it will take to get you back on track.
entries.s_4626423a: Greetings and welcome to Theed. I apologize, but I'm looking to speak with pilots and those seeking to become pilots. If you get involved with space flight, I might be able to answer some questions, but otherwise I'm not going to be of much help.
entries.s_3c8b5d06: I enjoy talking to pilots and hearing about their flights. Takes me back to some of my own best memories. Helps me to relive them.
entries.s_3b435c91: Greetings. Ah, tell me of your journeys in the great expanses beyond this planet. It has been too long since I last flew such a flight. I long to remember that feeling.
entries.s_2cc72ac: Could I ask some other questions?
entries.s_29894b97: I don't know how to check.
entries.s_270c87b2: How do I get them to repair my ship?
entries.s_232bfee8: Why don't you fly any more?
entries.s_21bf1a8c: How do I join the Alliance?
entries.s_2099fa73: Interesting. Why are you here outside the hangar?
entries.s_17bc5d9b: When you approach the space station, use SHIFT+C to target it and open communication with the commander. You will be asked if you want to purchase repairs or if you want to land on the planet.
entries.s_148c4dad: Very well then. Feel free to ask.
entries.s_143896d2: I think that the majority of pilot trainers are registered with the planetary map. Try opening the planetary map with CTRL+V. On the right-hand side is a listing of categories. Look under 'trainer' to find any local pilot teacher who's looking for pupils.
entries.s_12157feb: The military gives out free ships?
entries.do_not_edit: The English version of this file (greeter_theed_freighter_captain.stf) is automatically generated by the SwgConversationEditor.
